{"step_by_step_thinking": "The occlusal curve that contacts the buccal and lingual cusp tips of mandibular buccal teeth is called the Curve of Spee. The Curve of Spee is a natural curve that exists in the occlusion of the teeth. It is named after the German dentist, Friedrich Wilhelm von Spee, who first described it. The Curve of Spee is important for maintaining proper occlusion and distributing forces evenly across the teeth during chewing and biting.", "answer_choice": "B"}
